data.name: Chapter 1: The Escape
entries: {@creature Stitched Villager|AoIP}
The party must free themselves from captivity, before the stitchers can have their way with them.
Everyone also has a small red mark etched in the nape of the neck, this is the symbol of the wizard who placed them in stasis

You awake in near total darkness, the stone ground slick and cold to the touch. The inky blackness is only punctuated by the the soft and wretched groans the despaired.Suddenly, a crack of light pours in through the narrow eye-slit of a door, from beyond a gruff and muffled voice:
'Alright *hic* - up, UP, UP! Yous gonna be heading off to makes us good and shtrong soon *hic* - and trus' me, aint noone wanna be left behind...'
The soft slap of flesh on rock receeds into the distance, but the single crack of light catches on a particular stone - which begins to glow...
The party will be interrupted by a new stranger, on the other end of the sending stone that used to belong to Geralf...

entries.name: Escaping the Cell
entries: The door is bolted from the outside, however with a DC 18 strength check you can break the door off its hinges (with advantage if you get Gandrick to help)
The eye slit is wide enough for a stick or slender arm, with a DC 18 dex check you can try and lift the bolt from the other side (with advantage if you get one of the children to help)
There is a family of Farmers from the outskirts of Neverwinter who were snatched by the Stitchers in a raid. The family used to have two boys

items: Gandrick: level 1 man, husband and father, just wants to keep his family safe
Limella: level 1 woman, wife to Gandrick, wants to bring her family inside the walls of Neverwinter where its safer
Odwin: teenage boy, son of Gandrick and Limella, wants to avenge the death of his brother
Andrea: young girl, adopted by Gandrick and Limella after her family were killed by an Orcish raid

entries.name: Outside The Cell
entries: Beyond is a cellar complex, there are party + 1 guards in the area, they will try and wrestle the prisoners under control if they spot them.
There is a single large table (with a suspiciously dark red finish) in the center of the room, where all but one of the guards is sitting, drinking, and playing cards.
These guards will detect anyone who leaves the corridor, unless someone does something sneaky. They do not want to kill the party members, and will try and restrain them if possible
There is a smaller room attached to the left,  where another stitcher, more slight than the others, is studying and writing.
In this room there are with books and diagrams of human anatomy, along with an impressive array of sharp surgical implements.
The cell was at the end of a long torch lit corridor, you see 6 more doors in total - 3 on each side of the passageway. At the other end, the passageway connects to a larger room.
From the sounds of things a raucous party seems to be going on.
If the players check out the other cells along the way, roll a d6 to see what they find:

items: 3-4: the dead body of a prisoner lies slumped against the wall
5: A rabid creature huddles in the shadows, away from the light - if investigated its a crazed stitcher
6: A live villager lies in the cell, exhausted and close to death

entries.name: New Phandalin
entries: Free for now, the party venture out into the streets of Phandelin
If the family is still with them, they explain that if they can make it to the woods on the outskirts of town they should be able to lose any stitches and make it home safely to Neverwinter

Directly opposite the cellar door, lies the Inn, to their left the town square - where some kind of celebration seems to be underway, while the road to their right has a tall fleshy barricade stretching
all the way accross the road.
Good people of New Phandelin! I stand before you a humble and profligate man - for you have given me more of yourselves than I could ever have dreamed!
And it is because of your bravery, your selfless sacrifice, that we are able to gather here today - not just in peace, but in propsperity
Beforeme, this town was but a chink in the armor of the wilderness - waiting to be exploited, and exploited not by the good folk before me today -
but by the craven Lords of Neverwinter! Who sit behind their precious walls while they siphon the nectar of your sweat.
No longer! Look amongst yourselves, and gaze in awe at the beings you have become, possessed with the strength of many!
Before us all hangs the lifeless corpse of our foe - the foul and wicked Cryovain - who once thought himself the scourge of this land
But together we threw off the tyranny of his terror! And broke the his yoke of oppression with our own two, or in some cases more, hands!
On this day we remember the many who fell on that grim day - and, for many of us, give thanks for the boons they have left behind
For while it is the meek that shall inherit the earth - we meek shall one day be made strong! And that day is this day!
Brothers, sisters, today we remember we are knitted together as one! And hope that one day, our own stitch will cut through the threads of History!
For the Stitchers of New Phandelin! HUZZAH!

action.name: Multi-Limbed Grasp
entries: The Limbweaver Aberration can make three melee attacks with its limbs as part of its Multiattack.

action.name: Extendable Limbs
entries: The Limbweaver Aberration can extend one of its limbs up to 15 feet to make a melee attack against a target.

action.name: Regenerative Stitching
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the Limbweaver Aberration regains {@h}5 hit points.

action.name: Limb Toss
entries: The Limbweaver Aberration can detach one of its limbs and throw it as a ranged weapon with a range of 20/60 feet.
On a hit, the limb deals ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and grapples the target (escape {@dc 12}).
The limb can be reattached on the Limbweaver Aberration's turn as a bonus action.

data.name: Chapter 2: The Wizards Tower
entries: Having narrowly escaped the clutchers of Stitcher Geralf, the party follow the voice from the gem - as it leads them to a cliff side tower, but the stitchers are not far behind...

data.name: Chapter 3: Return to Icespire Peak
entries: After beating back the Stitchers, the party takes the advice of the Wizard and journeys back to Icespire Peak to retrace Cryovains last moments.

data.name: Chapter 4: The Boar and the Orc
entries: After being taken prisoner by the orc clan, the party is offered a choice by the god of the storms that may allow them to resist Stitcher Geralfs flesh magic.

data.name: Chapter 5: New Phandelin Beseiged
entries: The party begins their assault on the forces of the Phandelin Stitchers

data.name: Chapter 6: The Battle of New Phandelin
entries: The climactic battle between the party and Geralf and his lackeys

data.name: Chapter 7: The High Stitchers Heart
entries: With the High Stitcher defeated, the party must confront what to do with his heart.
